greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(row,col) where row n lists the numbers removed in round n of Flavius sieve. Array is read by antidiagonals A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10440; the first 144 antidiagonals of the array
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
formula: A(1,col) = 2*col; for row > 1, A(row,col) = A278492(row-1,(col*(row+1))-1). [Note that unlike this array, A278492 uses zero-based indexing for its rows and columns.]
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (define (A278507bi row col) (cond ((= 1 row) (* 2 col)) (else (A278492bi (- row 1) (+ -1 (* col (+ 1 row)))))))
;; Code for A278492bi given in A278492.
xref: This is array A278505 without its leftmost column, A000960.
Cf. A278529 (column index of n), A278538 (row index of n).
Cf. A255543 for analogous array for Lucky sieve.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 23 2016
